title: How to Defeat Flying Enemies and Bosses in Terraria

steps.headline: Try to stay out from under it, if the enemy is above you.
steps.description: Flying enemies typically stay above you and try to charge you. Stay away from the underside and this will be obsolete. However, they are able to charge diagonally.

steps.headline: If you are out from under it and it charges you diagonally, either:
steps.description: Jump over the assailant Sidestep it Take the hit (not recommended) If the enemy suffers knock-back, hit it with a broadsword. Short-swords are not advisable for this as they only go forward.

steps.headline: Jump.
steps.description: This is usually a good option. Charges and projectiles can be avoided by jumping (Pressing the space bar, but you know that already.) which propels you upward, over the enemy/launched attack. (This also works for ground enemies, but be aware that most walking enemies/slimes jump too.)

steps.headline: Hit smart projectiles with a broadsword.
steps.description: The smart projectiles are the ones that follow you, such as Servants of Cthulhu or Servants of Ocram, etc. Broadsword are used against them, helping you to not take as many hits. (Sometimes the smart projectiles drop hearts, they can be exploited for easy healing.)

steps.headline: Stay ahead of them, and when you're ready to attack, use a broadsword.
steps.description: If it gets in close, and you're about to get hit, jump over them. Preferably, use a Cloud in a Bottle for this, as they can jump like you.

steps.headline: Tackle Slimes differently.
steps.description: Their AI goes as follows: "Hops in one direction, slides on slopes, floats in water, follows player, damages player." Usually, striking them with a broadsword a few times is enough to eliminate them. The King Slime is exempt to this, as he is a mini-boss.

steps.headline: If in doubt, use ranged weapons.
steps.description: They can be used extremely well for all enemies. You can strike from a distance and not be hurt.

text: Main Approach (Flying Enemies In General) Try to stay out from under it, if the enemy is above you. Flying enemies typically stay above you and try to charge you. Stay away from the underside and this will be obsolete. However, they are able to charge diagonally. If you are out from under it and it charges you diagonally, either: Jump over the assailant Sidestep it Take the hit (not recommended) If the enemy suffers knock-back, hit it with a broadsword. Short-swords are not advisable for this as they only go forward. Jump. This is usually a good option. Charges and projectiles can be avoided by jumping (Pressing the space bar, but you know that already.) which propels you upward, over the enemy/launched attack. (This also works for ground enemies, but be aware that most walking enemies/slimes jump too.) Hit smart projectiles with a broadsword. The smart projectiles are the ones that follow you, such as Servants of Cthulhu or Servants of Ocram, etc. Broadsword are used against them, helping you to not take as many hits. (Sometimes the smart projectiles drop hearts, they can be exploited for easy healing.) Ground Enemies Stay ahead of them, and when you're ready to attack, use a broadsword. If it gets in close, and you're about to get hit, jump over them. Preferably, use a Cloud in a Bottle for this, as they can jump like you. Tackle Slimes differently. Their AI goes as follows: "Hops in one direction, slides on slopes, floats in water, follows player, damages player." Usually, striking them with a broadsword a few times is enough to eliminate them. The King Slime is exempt to this, as he is a mini-boss. If in doubt, use ranged weapons. They can be used extremely well for all enemies. You can strike from a distance and not be hurt.
